 <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַעֲנָה‎</span> **noun feminine** ==wormwood== (Late Hebrew ***id.***; Arabic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> is ***curse*** (verb <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***id.***), so Nabataean <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לצנת‎</span> (verb <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לען‎</span>) compare [[BDB#Cook|Cook]]<sup>Glossary</sup>); — only figurative of bitter things: — of perverted justice, [[Amos.5.7|Amos 5:7]]; [[Amos.6.12|Amos 6:12]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ראֹשׁ‎</span>; of result of idolatry, [[Deut.29.17|Deut 29:17]] (\|\| ***id.***); of <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎׳‎</span><span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎י‎</span>'s chastisement [[Jer.9.14|Jer 9:14]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מֵ֯ירֿאֹשׁ‎</span>, [[Jer.23.15|Jer 23:15]] (\|\| ***id.***), [[Lam.3.15|Lam 3:15]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מְרוֺרִים‎</span>), v[[Lam.3.19|Lam 3:19]] (\|\| <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ראֹשׁ‎</span>); simile of bitter (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎מָרָה‎</span>) result of intercourse with strange woman [[Prov.5.4|Prov 5:4]]. — On ***wormwood (Artemisia absinthium***, etc., Greek <span class="bdbLangGreek">ἀψίθιον</span>) compare [[BDB#Löw|Löw]]<sup>80f. 401, 421</sup> [[BDB#Tristr|Tristr]]<sup>Nat, Hist. Bib. 493</sup>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לָעַע‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לוע‎</span>
